{{cpp/title|toupper}}
{{cpp/string/byte/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=cctype|
int toupper( int ch );
}}

Converts the given character to uppercase according to the character conversion rules defined by the currently installed C locale.

In the default {{c|"C"}} locale, the following lowercase letters {{tt|abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz}} are replaced with respective uppercase letters {{tt|ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|ch|character to be converted. If the value of {{c|ch}} is not representable as {{c/core|unsigned char}} and does not equal {{c|EOF}}, the behavior is undefined.}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Converted character or {{c|ch}} if no uppercase version is defined by the current C locale.

===Notes===
{{cpp/string/byte/note unsigned char}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;cctype&gt;
#include &lt;climits&gt;
#include &lt;clocale&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;ranges&gt;

int main()
{
    for (auto bd{0}; unsigned char lc : std::views::iota(0, UCHAR_MAX))
        if (unsigned char uc = std::toupper(lc); uc != lc)
            std::cout &lt;&lt; lc &lt;&lt; uc &lt;&lt; (13 == ++bd ? '\n' : ' ');
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "\n\n";

    unsigned char c = '\xb8'; // the character ž in ISO-8859-15
                              // but ¸ (cedilla) in ISO-8859-1

    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.iso88591");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::hex &lt;&lt; std::showbase;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in iso8859-1, toupper('0xb8') gives " &lt;&lt; std::toupper(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::setlocale(LC_ALL, "en_US.iso885915");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "in iso8859-15, toupper('0xb8') gives " &lt;&lt; std::toupper(c) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
aA bB cC dD eE fF gG hH iI jJ kK lL mM
nN oO pP qQ rR sS tT uU vV wW xX yY zZ

in iso8859-1, toupper('0xb8') gives 0xb8
in iso8859-15, toupper('0xb8') gives 0xb4
}}
